transportAdvice: Zagreb has a well-developed tram network that connects the city centre with most tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The compact upper and lower town districts are very walkable, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow, Zagreb in January is quiet and atmospheric with low tourist crowds.
Still cold with possible snow and frost, though days begin to lengthen slightly toward the end of the month.
Early spring brings mild days and occasional rain, with the city starting to come alive after winter.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming parks and occasional showers, a good time to explore the city on foot.
Warm and green with longer days, May is one of the most enjoyable months to visit Zagreb.
Warm early summer with occasional thunderstorms, outdoor cafes and terraces are in full swing.
Hot and mostly sunny, July is peak summer with lively street life and outdoor festivals.
Similar to July with hot, dry conditions and plenty of sunshine, though brief thunderstorms are possible.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures make September an excellent month to visit with fewer crowds.
Crisp autumn days with colourful foliage and increasing rainfall, still pleasant for sightseeing.
Cool and often overcast with frequent rain, November marks the onset of the colder, wetter season.
Cold and festive, Zagreb hosts one of Europe's most celebrated Christmas markets throughout December.
